original: On February 23, 1879, the 7th exhibition of the Association of Traveling Art Exhibitions opened in Saint Petersburg and continued until March 25, before moving to Moscow, where it commenced on April 22. During the Saint Petersburg segment of the exhibition, the painting "Overgrown Pond" by Vasily Polenov was not displayed; however, the catalog listed three other works by the artist: "Udilshchiki," "Grandmother's Garden," and "Summer." T
sampled: On February 23, 1879, the 7th exhibition of the Association of Traveling Art Exhibitions opened in Saint Petersburg and continued until March 25, before moving to Moscow, where it commenced on April 22. During the Saint Petersburg segment of this showcase, the painting "Overgrown Pond" by Vasily Polenov was not displayed; however, the catalog listed three other works by the artist: "Udilshchiki," "Grandmother's Garden," plus "Summer." T
